Class LoadAndRemapMatrix.Inputs

java.lang.Object
org.tensorflow.op.RawOpInputs<LoadAndRemapMatrix>
org.tensorflow.op.linalg.LoadAndRemapMatrix.Inputs
Enclosing class:
LoadAndRemapMatrix
public static class LoadAndRemapMatrix.Inputs extends RawOpInputs<LoadAndRemapMatrix>

  • Field Details

    • ckptPath

      public final Operand<TString> ckptPath
      Path to the TensorFlow checkpoint (version 2, TensorBundle) from which the old matrix Tensor will be loaded.

    • oldTensorName

      public final Operand<TString> oldTensorName
      Name of the 2-D Tensor to load from checkpoint.

    • rowRemapping

      public final Operand<TInt64> rowRemapping
      An int Tensor of row remappings (generally created by generate_vocab_remapping). Even if no row remapping is needed, this must still be an index-valued Tensor (e.g. [0, 1, 2, ...]), or a shifted index-valued Tensor (e.g. [8, 9, 10, ...], for partitioned Variables).

    • colRemapping

      public final Operand<TInt64> colRemapping
      An int Tensor of column remappings (generally created by generate_vocab_remapping). May be a size-0 Tensor if only row remapping is to be done (e.g. column ordering is the same).

    • initializingValues

      public final Operand<TFloat32> initializingValues
      A float Tensor containing values to fill in for cells in the output matrix that are not loaded from the checkpoint. Length must be exactly the same as the number of missing / new cells.

    • numRows

      public final long numRows
      Number of rows (length of the 1st dimension) in the output matrix.

    • numCols

      public final long numCols
      Number of columns (length of the 2nd dimension) in the output matrix.

    • maxRowsInMemory

      public final long maxRowsInMemory
      The maximum number of rows to load from the checkpoint at once. If less than or equal to 0, the entire matrix will be loaded into memory. Setting this arg trades increased disk reads for lower memory usage.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inputs

      public Inputs(GraphOperation op)
